title: Authors and Citation
text: Armin Rauschenberger. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rauschenberger (2022). transreg: Penalised regression multiple sets prior effects. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {transreg: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects},   author = {Armin Rauschenberger},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

what: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior coefficients
title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects
text: Improves predictive performance ridge lasso regression exploiting one sources prior information importance direction effects.

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects
text: Install current release CRAN: latest development version GitHub:

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects
text: Armin Rauschenberger, Zied Landoulsi, Mark van de Wiel, Enrico Glaab (2022). “Penalised regression multiple sets prior effects”. Manuscript preparation.

title: Cross-validation — cv.transfer
text: Performs external \(k\)-fold cross-validation estimate predictive performance different methods

title: Cross-validation — cv.transfer
code: cv.transfer(   target,   source = NULL,   prior = NULL,   z = NULL,   family,   alpha,   scale = "iso",   sign = FALSE,   select = TRUE,   switch = TRUE,   foldid.ext = NULL,   nfolds.ext = 10,   foldid.int = NULL,   nfolds.int = 10,   type.measure = "deviance",   alpha.prior = NULL,   partitions = NULL,   monotone = NULL,   prs = TRUE,   multiridge = FALSE )

title: Cross-validation — cv.transfer
text: target list slot x (feature matrix n rows p columns) slot y (target vector length n) source list k lists, slot x (feature matrix m_i rows p columns) slot y (target vector length m_i) prior prior coefficients: matrix \(p\) rows \(k\) columns z prior weights family character "gaussian", "binomial", "poisson" alpha elastic net mixing parameter (0=ridge, 1=lasso) scale "exp" exponential scaling (3 parameters), "iso" isotonic scaling (1+p parameters), "sam" shape-constrained additive scaling sign sign discovery procedure: logical select select sources: logical switch choose positive negative weights source: logical foldid.ext external fold identifiers nfolds.ext number external folds foldid.int internal fold identifiers nfolds.int number internal folds type.measure character alpha.prior alpha source regression partitions monotone: GRridge monotone logical prs logical multiridge logical

title: Cross-validation — cv.transfer
code: n <- 100; p <- 500 X <- matrix(rnorm(n=n*p),nrow=n,ncol=p) beta <- rnorm(p)*rbinom(n=p,size=1,prob=0.2) y <- X %*% beta object <- cv.transfer(target=list(y=y,x=X),prior=beta,scale="com",family="gaussian",alpha=0) #> Warning: Argument select not implemented. #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select title: Simulation — .simulate
text: Simulates data

title: Simulation — .simulate
code: .simulate(   p = 1000,   n.target = 100,   n.source = 150,   k = 3,   family = "gaussian",   prop = 0.01,   rho.beta = 0.95,   rho.x = 0.95,   w = 0.5 )

title: Simulation — .simulate
text: p number features n.target sample size target data set n.source sample size(s) source data set(s), scalar vector length k k number source data sets family "Gaussian", "binomial" "poisson" prop approximate proportion features effects rho.beta correlation effects (across different data sets) rho.x base decreasing correlation structure correlation features w weight signal noise

text: Calculates residuals observed outcome predicted values (Gaussian family) predicted probablities (binomial family).

text: y target: vector length \(n\) y_hat predicted values: vector length n, matrix n rows k columns family "gaussian" "binomial"

text: Assigns signs prior weights obtain prior coefficients

title: Sign discovery — sign.disc

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg-package
text: R package starnet implements penalised regression multiple sets prior effects.

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg-package
text: Use function transreg model fitting. Type library(transreg) ?transreg help("transreg)" open help file. See vignette examples. Type vignette("transreg") browseVignettes("transreg") open vignette.

text: Armin Rauschenberger, Zied Landoulsi, Mark van de Wiel, Enrico Glaab (2022). "Penalised regression multiple sets prior effects". Manuscript preparation. armin.rauschenberger@uni.lu

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg-package

what: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg
title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg
text: Implements penalised regression multiple sets prior effects

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg
code: transreg(   y,   X,   prior,   family = "gaussian",   alpha = 1,   foldid = NULL,   nfolds = 10,   scale = "iso",   sign = FALSE,   switch = TRUE,   select = TRUE,   multiridge = FALSE )

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg
text: y target: vector length \(n\) X features: matrix \(n\) rows \(p\) columns prior prior coefficients: matrix \(p\) rows \(k\) columns family character "gaussian", "binomial", "poisson" alpha elastic net mixing parameter (0=ridge, 1=lasso) foldid fold identifiers: vector length \(n\) entries 1 nfolds nfolds number folds: integer scale "exp" exponential scaling (3 parameters), "iso" isotonic scaling (1+p parameters), "sam" shape-constrained additive scaling sign sign discovery procedure: logical switch choose positive negative weights source: logical select select sources: logical multiridge logical

title: Penalised regression with multiple sets of prior effects — transreg
code: n <- 100; p <- 500 X <- matrix(rnorm(n=n*p),nrow=n,ncol=p) beta <- rnorm(p)*rbinom(n=p,size=1,prob=0.2) prior <- beta # plus noise y <- X %*% beta prior <- ifelse(beta<(-1),0,ifelse(beta>1,beta,0)) plot(x=beta,y=prior)  object <- transreg(y=y,X=X,prior=prior,scale="com") #> Warning: Consider sign discovery procedure. #> Warning: Argument select not implemented. #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple #> Warning: Argument select not implemented.  #> Warning: temporary version com.multiple  #predict.transreg(object,newx=X) #predict.trial(object,newx=X)
